description: From late Middle English, from Late Latin mandibula (“a jaw”), from mandō (“to chew, masticate”) +‎ -bula (instrument noun suffix).

entries.meaning: The jaw or a jawbone, especially the lower jawbone in mammals and fishes.
examples: Synonyms: dentary, dentary bone, inferior maxillary bone, jawbone, lower jaw, submaxilla

entries.meaning: Either of the upper and lower segments of a bird's beak.
Any of various invertebrate mouthparts serving to hold or bite food materials.
One of the anterior pair of mouthparts of an arthropod, designed for holding and cutting food.
